conclusion: The p-V diagram shows the process of an ideal gas from state A to state B and then to state C. The temperature of the gas in state A is given as 27°C. The p-V diagram is a graphical representation of the relationship between pressure (p) and volume (V) for an ideal gas. The temperature of the gas is the temperature at which the gas is at equilibrium.
From the p-V diagram, the gas undergoes a change from state A to state B and then to state C.
The change in volume from state A to state B is 1 × 10^-3 m^3, and the change in volume from state B to state C is 2 × 10^-3 m^3.
